other_tests.findings: In Family A, serum FT4 was low (0.51 ng/dl) but serum TSH and FT3 were normal; serum Tg was elevated (1312 ng/ml). In Family B, serum TSH was elevated (7.08 /H9262 U/ml) with low FT4 (0.73 ng/dl) and normal FT3.
Showed an organification defect in Family A.
Suggestive of follicular neoplasia in Family B.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Increase in L-thyroxine requirements after surgery due to loss of the thyroid as a source of T3.

other_tests.findings: Normal thyrocytes showed fast iodide uptake while T-PS2 cells demonstrated increased iodide retention.
other_tests.changes_over_time: T-PS2 cells reached iodide uptake plateau later than normal cells, indicating differences in efficiency.

other_tests.findings: Thyroid glands showed hypercellular appearance with tall columnar cells in follicles; both propositi lacked pendrin immunoreactivity at the luminal border.
